elements.label: Workspace
elements.helpText:
The selected folder is used as the workspace where all intermediate and output files will be written.

If the selected folder does not exist, it will be created.

If datasets already exist in the selected folder, they will be overwritten.

elements.label: Results Suffix
elements.helpText: A suffix to append to results.

elements.label: Land Cover (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file representing land-use/land-cover.

elements.label: Transition Table (CSV)
elements.helpText: This table contains the land-cover transition likelihoods, priority of transitions, area change, proximity suitiblity, proximity effect distance, seed size, short name, and patch size.

elements.label: Calculate Priorities
elements.helpText: This option enables calculation of the land-cover priorities using analytical hierarchical processing. A matrix table must be entered below. Optionally, the priorities can manually be entered in the priority column of the land attributes table.

elements.label: Priorities Table (CSV)
elements.helpText: This table contains a matrix of land-cover type pairwise priorities used to calculate land-cover priorities.

elements.label: Factors Table
elements.helpText: This table lists the factors that determine suitability of the land-cover for change, and includes: the factor name, layer name, distance of influence, suitability value, weight of the factor, distance breaks, and applicable land-cover.

elements.label: Factor Weight
elements.helpText: The factor weight is a value between 0 and 1 which determines the weight given to the factors vs. the expert opinion likelihood rasters.  For example, if a weight of 0.3 is entered then 30% of the final suitability is contributed by the factors and the likelihood matrix contributes 70%.  This value is entered on the tool interface.

elements.label: Rasterization Method
options: Only pixels with covered center points

elements.label: Constraints Layer (Vector)
elements.helpText: An OGR-supported vector file.  This is a vector layer which indicates the parts of the landscape that are protected of have constraints to land-cover change.  The layer should have one field named "porosity" with a valuebetween 0 and 1 where 0 means its fully protected and 1 means its fully open to change.

elements.label: Constraints Field
elements.helpText: The field from the override table that contains the value for the override.

elements.label: Override Layer (Vector)
elements.helpText: An OGR-supported vector file. This is a vector (polygon) layer with land-cover types in the same scale and projection as the input land-cover. This layer is used to override all the changes and is applied after the rule conversion is complete.

elements.label: Override Field
elements.helpText: The field from the override table that contains the value for the override.

elements.label: Rasterization Method
options: Only pixels with covered center points
